article_title: Greg Simon and Richard Titus: Protectionists Pick Your Pocket Again
article_text:
The recent housing uptick has prompted many Americans to buy new homes and renovate existing ones. But those in the market to remodel a kitchen or replace wood flooring might experience sticker shock. Not because of a bad economy or inflation. It's the result of complaints by a handful of American companies that make hardwood plywood in the U.S. They already control 80% of the market for domestic hardwood plywood and now they're seeking to further exploit their stronghold by edging out overseas competition.

As a result...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Greg Simon and Richard Titus say that if tariffs kick in, you'll pay more for cabinets and anything made with Chinese plywood, and U.S. jobs will be lost too.
twitter.title: Protectionists Pick Your Pocket Again
